column4: having trouble with ssh server. I get a connection refused error when accessing from outside, but i'm fine inside. Port is forwarded, and everything seems to be in order. any ideas?
Have you checked your sshd_config file?
I have, and there's nothing there that seems out of the ordinary... What should I look for?
Do you have PasswordAuthentication on?
Or are you only using keys?
no, I use a password
Is PasswordAuthentication set to yes?
Still sounds like a port forwarding issue if you can do it on your local network.
Yeah, but it's forwarded in my router...
pastebin your sshd_config pleaes
ok. how do I pastebin
pastebin.com
http://pastebin.com/EHhsfPLN
comment out the ListenAddress
Then "sudo /etc/init.d/ssh restart"
So yeah, run "sudo service ssh restart"
ok. how the freak do I get vim to edit.
Got the service restarted, but still getting the connection refused error
You sure you changed it? You did "sudo nano" or "sudo gedit" ?
What is the command you are doing?
ssh username@publicaddress (censored, of course)
if it helps at all, my goal is to do dynamic tunneling
The only things I can think of that would be preventing you from being able to SSH into your system would be your config file and your firewall.
is there a system firewall that would be blocking it? because I don't have one anywhere else...
